items.content_html: My son turned 6 on Sunday and it got me thinking about my own 6th birthday party where all the parents of my friends just dropped off their kindergartners at our house in a seedier part of town and then left. Their parents had never even met my mom. Man, how times have changed!
items.content_text: My son turned 6 on Sunday and it got me thinking about my own 6th birthday party where all the parents of my friends just dropped off their kindergartners at our house in a seedier part of town and then left. Their parents had never even met my mom. Man, how times have changed!

items.content_html: 20 years ago, ‘I’m Wide Awake, It’s Morning’ and ‘Digital Ash in a Digital Urn’ by Bright Eyes came out. Feeling older every day.
items.content_text: 20 years ago, ‘I’m Wide Awake, It’s Morning’ and ‘Digital Ash in a Digital Urn’ by [Bright Eyes](https://www.instagram.com/p/DFQo4cDS0Um/?img_index=2&igsh=MTRkY2g5emJrbXNldA==) came out. Feeling older every day.

items.content_html:
At a concert at Mississippi Studios in Portland between sets, and honestly, I’m kind of floored. It hit me earlier that the last time I saw Lady Lamb perform here was back in 2019. That was almost six years ago, but with two kids, COVID, and the general whirlwind of life, time has felt like a strange, elastic blur.

It’s as if part of my life paused when I became a parent. Life hasn’t stopped being fun. I make a point of doing things I love and getting out as much as I can, especially now that my kids are no longer babies. But it sure is different these days. What a trip.

items.content_html: Not my photo. Posted on the Gordie Howe Bridge website. Just a lovely bridge, Detroit.
items.content_text: Not my photo. Posted on the Gordie Howe Bridge [website](https://www.gordiehoweinternationalbridge.com/en/gallery). Just a lovely bridge, Detroit.

items.content_html: Trying to work up the energy to make it to this Lady Lamb show at Mississippi Studios tonight. Still wiped out and recovering.
items.content_text: Trying to work up the energy to make it to this Lady Lamb show at Mississippi Studios tonight. Still wiped out and recovering.

items.content_html: I’ve have had two back-to-back, pretty nasty illnesses this month. This caused me to abandon my photo a day project. I thought that it would encourage me to be creative and get out more, but I decided it wasn’t serving me the way that it would and I didn’t like how it was making me feel.

items.content_html: A little over halfway through the nerdiest book I’ve read in years. Of course I love it.
